verses.text: 葡萄園的比喻我要為我所愛的唱歌，這歌是關於他的葡萄園：我所愛的人有一個葡萄園，在肥美的山岡上。

words.note: Lit. 'grape garden'
Indicates intention or desire.
Forms a nominal phrase with following verb.
Turns a verb phrase into a noun phrase.
Lit. 'grape garden'
Forms a nominal phrase with following verb.
Turns a verb phrase into a noun phrase.
Lit. 'grape garden'
Often used for land or soil.

verses.text: 他把園子的泥土挖鬆了，撿去石頭，栽種了上好的葡萄樹；在園中建造了一座守望樓，又鑿了一個榨酒池。他期望結出好葡萄，卻結出野葡萄。

words.note: Indicates the object is disposed of or acted upon.
A verb-complement construction.
Indicates completion or change of state.
A verb-complement construction.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Indicates completion or change of state.
A disyllabic morpheme for 'grape'.

verses.text: 耶路撒冷的居民和猶大人哪！現在請你們在我與我的葡萄園之間斷定是非吧！

words.note: Lit. 'Judah people'.
Indicates exclamation or emphasis.
More formal than 和 (hé).
Lit. 'grape garden'
Indicates suggestion, request, or mild command.

verses.text: 我為我的葡萄園所作的以外，還有甚麼要作的呢？我期望它結出好葡萄，它為甚麼倒結出野葡萄呢？

words.note: Lit. 'grape garden'
Forms a nominal phrase with following verb.
Turns a verb phrase into a noun phrase.
Indicates obligation or desire.
Softens a question or asks 'how about...?'
A disyllabic morpheme for 'grape'.
Emphasizes an unexpected or contrary outcome.
Softens a question or asks 'how about...?'

verses.text: 現在我告訴你們，我要怎樣處理我的葡萄園：我要把它的籬笆撤去，使它被吞滅；我要把它的圍牆拆毀，使它被踐踏。

words.note: Indicates intention or desire.
Lit. 'grape garden'
Indicates intention or desire.
Indicates the object is disposed of or acted upon.
Indicates a passive voice construction.
Indicates intention or desire.
Indicates the object is disposed of or acted upon.
Indicates a passive voice construction.

verses.text: 我要使它荒廢，不再修剪，也不再耕耘，荊棘和蒺藜卻要長起來；我也要吩咐雲不再降雨在園子上。

words.note: Often used metaphorically in the Bible for troubles.
A type of prickly weed, often paired with 荊棘.
Directional complement, indicating rising or beginning.
Often used with 在 to indicate location on top of something.

verses.text: 因為萬軍之耶和華的葡萄園就是以色列家，他喜悅的樹就是猶大人；他期望的是公平，但看到的只是流血的事；他期望的是公義，聽到的只是哀叫聲。

words.note: A common divine title in the Old Testament.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun-like entity.
Refers to lamentation or cries of suffering.

verses.text: 人民的惡行──六禍那些使房屋連接房屋，使田地連接田地，以致不留餘地的人，有禍了！你們只可以獨居在境內。

words.note: A heading in some Bible versions for a list of curses/woes.

words.definition: so that, with the result that

words.note: A common biblical exclamation expressing a curse or warning.

verses.text: 我聽聞萬軍之耶和華說：「必有許多房屋變成荒涼，甚至那些又大又美的房屋也沒有人居住。

words.note: A common divine title in the Old Testament.
Used in the pattern '又...又...' meaning 'both...and...'
Used in the pattern '又...又...' meaning 'both...and...'

verses.text: 十公頃葡萄園只出二十二公升酒；二百二十公升穀種只結二十二公升糧食。」

words.note: Metric unit for area (10,000 square meters).
Metric unit for volume.
Metric unit for volume.
Metric unit for volume.

verses.text: 那些清早起來，追求濃酒，留連到晚上，以致因酒發燒的人，有禍了！

words.note: Implies lingering excessively or indulging.

words.definition: with the result that, so that

words.note: Here implies being inflamed or consumed by drink.
A common biblical expression for pronouncing judgment or sorrow.

verses.text: 在他們的筵席上，有琴、瑟、手鼓、笛和酒，但他們不理耶和華的作為，也不留心他手所作的。

words.note: Used as a locative suffix.
Refers to ancient Chinese stringed instruments, here generally 'zither'.
A large ancient Chinese plucked string instrument, similar to a zither.

verses.text: 所以我的人民因無知被擄去；他們的尊貴人十分飢餓；他們的群眾極其乾渴。

words.note: Refers to people of high status or nobility.

verses.text: 故此，陰間擴張它的咽喉，張大它的口，沒有限量；耶路撒冷城的榮耀（「榮耀」或譯「貴族」）、群眾、喧嚷的人和在城中作樂的人，都要下到陰間。

words.note: The abode of the dead in Hebrew scripture.
Used as a locative suffix.
The abode of the dead in Hebrew scripture.

verses.text: 卑賤人俯首，尊貴人降卑，眼目高傲的也降卑。

words.note: Refers to people of low social standing.
Refers to people of high status or nobility.
Often used in a religious or moral context for humility.
Often used in a religious or moral context for humility.

verses.text: 唯獨萬軍之耶和華，因公平被高舉；至聖的 神，因公義顯為聖。

words.note: Often used in 'LORD of hosts' (萬軍之耶和華).
Classical Chinese equivalent of '的'.
Capitalized for the singular God.

verses.text: 那時羊羔必來吃草，像在自己的草場一樣；富裕者的荒場被寄居者隨意吃用。
那些人用虛假的繩索牽引罪孽，又像用車繩拉罪惡的人，有禍了！

words.note: A common biblical expression for pronouncing judgment.

verses.text: 他們說：「願他趕快、迅速地成就他的作為，給我們看看！願以色列的聖者所計劃的臨近！願它來到，好讓我們知道！」

words.note: Reduplication of verb indicates a casual or brief action.
Refers to God in this context.
Used before a verb to form a nominalized phrase.

words.definition: so that, in order to let

verses.text: 那些稱惡為善，稱善為惡，以暗為光，以光為暗，以苦為甜，以甜為苦的人，有禍了！

words.note: An idiom expressing moral perversion.
An idiom expressing moral perversion.
An idiom expressing spiritual confusion.
An idiom expressing spiritual confusion.
An idiom expressing distorted perception.
An idiom expressing distorted perception.
A common biblical expression for pronouncing judgment.

verses.text: 那些自以為有智慧，自視為聰明的人，有禍了！

words.note: Lit. 'self-regard as'
Important biblical concept
A common biblical lament or warning.

verses.text: 那些勇於喝酒，又精於調和濃酒的人，有禍了！

words.note: Refers to fermented drinks, often stronger than wine.

verses.text: 他們因受了賄賂，就稱惡人為義；卻把義人的權益奪去。

words.note: Key theological term.

verses.text: 因此，火舌怎樣吞滅碎稭，乾草怎樣落在火燄之中，照樣，他們的根必像腐朽之物，他們的花必像塵土飛揚；因為他們棄絕萬軍之耶和華的訓誨，藐視以色列聖者的話。

words.note: Figurative usage, also found in Acts 2.
Often used in biblical contexts for destruction.
Common biblical metaphor for worthlessness or fragility.
Literary/formal way of saying 'inside'.
Classical Chinese possessive/linking particle.
A title for God, emphasizing His sovereignty over heavenly armies.
Often refers to God in the Old Testament.

verses.text: 所以耶和華的怒氣向他的子民發作，他伸出手來擊打他們，群山都震動，他們的屍體在街上好像糞土，雖然這樣，他的怒氣還未轉消，他的手仍然伸出。

words.note: The Tetragrammaton YHWH transliterated.
Often refers to God's chosen people.
Used metaphorically for something worthless or despised.
Often used in biblical context for God's anger subsiding.

verses.text: 懲罰快要來臨他必豎立旗幟，招一國的人從遠方而來，發出哨聲把他們從地極召來；看！他們必急速快奔而來。

words.note: Often refers to distant parts of the world in biblical context.

verses.text: 他們當中沒有疲倦的，沒有絆倒的，沒有打盹的，也沒有睡覺的；他們的腰帶沒有放鬆，鞋帶也沒有折斷。
他們的箭銳利，所有的弓都上了弦；他們的馬蹄看來像火石，車輛似旋風。
他們的吼叫像母獅，他們的咆哮如幼獅；他們咆哮，攫取獵物，把它叼去，無人援救。
到那日，他們要向以色列人咆哮，像海浪的澎湃聲一樣；人若望著這地，就只見黑暗與災難；光在雲中也成了黑暗。

words.note: Lit. 'Israel people'.
